text: Sabri Yirmibeşoğlu (1 September 1928 - 2 January 2016) was a Turkish army general. He was Secretary-General of the National Security Council from 1988 to 1990. He was said to be behind a failed killing of President Turgut Özal in 1988. He was born in Foça, Izmir. Yirmibeşoğlu died from kidney failure on 2 January 2016 in Istanbul, aged 87. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:Disease- related deaths in Turkey Category:Turkish generals Category:Turkish politicians
title: Sabri Yirmibeşoğlu
